title: 14-year-old arrested after man kicked into moving train at Back Bay
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 14-year-old boy was arrested for allegedly kicking a man into a moving train at Back Bay Station.
The juvenile, charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon, was part of a group that attacked a 27-year-old man.
The victim sustained a forehead injury but was alert; the group of juveniles fled, and the investigation is ongoing.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com invites readers to take a quiz on current local news in Greater Boston.
The quiz covers trending stories and events in the Greater Boston area.
Peter Chianca has been the general assignment editor at Boston.com since 2019.

title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville creates 'Bye Bridget' merchandise after an online critic opposed their charitable donations.
The bakery donates 10% of sales to White Bear Area Food Shelf, responding to criticism with humor and new merchandise.
Proceeds from the 'Bye Bridget' line will also go to charity, continuing the bakery's long-standing philanthropic efforts.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gerard "Jerry" Boucher, 72, and Kathleen "Kit" Boucher, 71, died after falling through ice at Bee’s River in Eastham.
The couple's daughter, Katy Boucher, shared memories highlighting their dedication to community and helping others.
Visiting hours for the Bouchers' service will be held at St. Joan of Arc Church in Orleans on Feb. 27-28.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg homes are under investigation as arson, according to State Fire Marshal Jon Davine.
Apartment fires on Feb. 14-15 on Blossom and Day streets were quickly contained; a third fire occurred Feb. 18 on Myrtle Avenue.
The Myrtle Avenue fire displaced seven individuals and injured one. Informants on these incidents may contact the Arson Watch Reward Program.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died at 53 from ALS, less than a year after his diagnosis.
Dane became a prominent advocate for ALS awareness, honored as advocate of the year by the ALS Network in 2025.
Dane is survived by his wife, Rebecca Gayheart, and daughters Billie and Georgia; his memoir is set for release in 2026.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Mass. State Police members charged with manslaughter in Enrique Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death are suspended with pay.
Lt. Jennifer Penton and Troopers Rodriguez, Montanez, LaMonte face charges of causing serious injury during training.
An independent investigation led to charges; a review of State Police training practices is nearing completion.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police are preparing for a potential takeover at South Shore Plaza scheduled for Friday at 7 p.m.
The planned takeover was advertised on social media, prompting police to develop an operational plan for public safety.
Past takeovers involved street blockages, car stunts, and police vehicle attacks, leading to increased security measures.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins sees the Boston Celtics as a 'dark horse' for the 2026 NBA title if Jayson Tatum returns.
The Celtics, without Tatum this season, have a second-place record of 35-19 in the Eastern Conference.
Perkins praises Jaylen Brown as an MVP contender and names Derrick White and Payton Pritchard as key performers.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN analyst suggests Patriots trade a 2026 1st, 3rd, and 6th-round picks for AJ Brown and a 2nd-round pick.
AJ Brown, 28, coming off his fourth consecutive 1,000-yard season, is under contract with the Eagles through 2029.
Brown's previous experience with coach Mike Vrabel makes him a logical fit to upgrade the Patriots' receiver group.
